TopicTitle: [1.0.4][Kopernicus]KerbolPlus v.2.3.9 - a planet pack that ads the legendary Gas Planet 2 and more.

Articles.Content: In searching for something else I found this thread about Nova's concepts, http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/1849 If you haven't seen it already it could be useful. In particular it's got technical details like orbital radii and atmospheric pressures.

Mmmm interesting... Seen it before creating the mod 7 months ago, but some things do not match with the new system post 0.15. Also, Keelon was supposed to have 5G gravity like Nova planned, but trough testing, we decided that the biggest safe value is 2G.
When is 2.4.0

When is 2.4.0

Please stop. Next update is in one month or less depending on my time. We may release a proper hotfix trough.

Mmmm interesting... Seen it before creating the mod 7 months ago, but some things do not match with the new system post 0.15. Also, Keelon was supposed to have 5G gravity like Nova planned, but trough testing, we decided that the biggest safe value is 2G.
What would happen if you made it 5g??

What would happen if you made it 5g??

Well, all the parts of a vessel crush eachother and you cannot slow enough to have any parts survive. Tested by Ashley.

Well, all the parts of a vessel crush eachother and you cannot slow enough to have any parts survive. Tested by Ashley.

But wasn't the intention to be unable to land on it?

But wasn't the intention to be unable to land on it?

Well, where was the fun of taking of if you couldn't even land? Also, Keelon was supposed to be a bit smaller than Jupiter but we shrunk it with the gravity. Before KillAshley's huge collaboration, I was working on an ocean planet around keelon, that had rings... old Kopernicus Tech dayz....

Edited August 8, 2015 by Claw
Yeah, I think Keelon is better as a "super Eve", which needs a landing to be possible in order to have the challenge of a ascent.

Well, where was the fun of taking of if you couldn't even land? Also, Keelon was supposed to be a bit smaller than Jupiter but we shrunk it with the gravity. Before KillAshley's huge collaboration, I was working on an ocean planet around keelon, that had rings... old Kopernicus Tech dayz....

Jupiter??? Was Keelon supposed to be a bit smaller than Jupiter in radius or in mass? And how big is it as per the latest release?

I know the answer is probably going to be "well get there and see it for yourself", but my probe isn't scheduled to arrive any earlier than 10 years tehe

Uh oh... i was a bit tired... I meant Jool.

With Kopernicus 0.2.4 Kerbol Plus fails to load as you may know. Looking at the log I get "Failed to load Body" for Keelon, Daphy, Fonso, and Potatus. I simply removed them (removing the entire Keelon system) and the remaining bodies in Kerbol Plus then load fine. (Though I've not tested any further than checking they appear in the tracking station).

I've not looked into why those four bodies aren't loading but hopefully you at least know now what to look into.

I've not looked into why those four bodies aren't loading but hopefully you at least know now what to look into.

I think I know why... before KillAshley leaved, he "revamped" the atmospheres of those exact bodies. I shold ask him about that. I don't believe that he made a mistake trougt, but something may have changed since 0.0.7...
OK huys... I have 3 days of testing before leaving again, to test the mod and try to fix the bugs. Standby.
What is the testing.

Similar issue here, again with Pergas. I touched down, the craft stopped, but was still counted as "Flying Low". I was able to work around the problem by quicksaving, and editing the quicksave to set the affected craft as landed.

If you don't mind, what editor did you use? I tried this with default Notepad and ended up losing control of the craft. It was landed though, at least.

What is the testing.

Testing the hotfix!

BTW everyone, I've fixed the black seams bug, atmospheres bug, negative altitudes bug, and PQS bugs and I'll be puting up the download link tomorrow!

Also, started work on the next MAJOR update, created some crystal models for Faz, Started work on the ringed lava ocean planet Calad! Started work on the oblate moon of keelon, Womp, that has A giant canyon on it's equator!

Thank god I found time today!
